headline: FedEx says it will return any tariff refunds to customers, shippers who paid them
summary: FedEx said it will return any tariff refunds it receives to the shippers and customers who paid them after Trump's IEEPA tariffs were struck down as illegal.

headline: FedEx vows to pass any tariff refunds it gets from U.S. on to customers
summary: FedEx said it will reimburse customers if the Trump administration provides refunds following a Supreme Court ruling that struck down emergency tariffs.

headline: UPS facility overtakes FedEx as world’s largest express air cargo hub
summary: The UPS based in Louisville, Kentucky, has edged past FedEx in Memphis, Tennessee, as the largest express air cargo hub in the world, a new report says. The post UPS facility overtakes FedEx as world’s largest express air cargo hub appeared first on FreightWaves.

raw.headline: UPS facility overtakes FedEx as world’s largest express air cargo hub
raw.summary: The UPS based in Louisville, Kentucky, has edged past FedEx in Memphis, Tennessee, as the largest express air cargo hub in the world, a new report says. The post UPS facility overtakes FedEx as world’s largest express air cargo hub appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: FedEx says it will return to customers any refunds it gets back from Trump's illegal tariffs
summary: Delivery company FedEx said in a statement on Thursday that it will return any tariff refund it might get to shippers and customers who paid them.  The statement came after FedEx filed suit in the U.S. Court of International Trade to request a refund on what it paid for tariffs set by President Donald Trump under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.  On Friday, the Supreme Court ruled that the IEEPA tariffs are illegal.

On Friday, the Supreme Court ruled that the IEEPA tariffs are illegal.

headline: FedEx, Costco, Goodyear: Companies Race to Get Tariff Money Back
summary: 1,800 (at least) That's the number of companies that have filed lawsuits seeking refunds on President Trump's tariffs, many of which the Supreme Court has struck down. Most—including well-known names like Costco and Goodyear Tire & Rubber—filed ahead of the Supreme Court ruling.

headline: How FedEx’s Tariff Refund Lawsuit Could Reshape Costs and Strategy for FedEx (FDX) Investors
summary: Earlier in February, FedEx filed a lawsuit in the U.S. Court of International Trade seeking a full refund, plus interest and costs, of emergency tariffs it paid under President Trump’s now-invalidated International Emergency Economic Powers Act orders. This move positions FedEx among the first major corporations to test the scope of the Supreme Court’s ruling, with any tariff recovery potentially affecting its costs, cash flow, and approach to international trade operations. We’ll now look...
